title: Four Men Arrested in Drug Overdose Death of 'The Wire' Actor Michael K. Williams; Men charged as members of an alleged fentanyl and heroin conspiracy that authorities link to the death of the 54-year-old actor
text:
Michael K. Williams was found dead on Sept. 6 in a drug overdose. The drugs that the 54-year-old actor ingested were sold to him a day earlier by the organization, the U.S. attorney said.

One of the accused, Irvin Cartagena, was caught on video allegedly handing the drugs to Mr. Williams, according to a still shot from surveillance video provided by the U.S. attorney's office.

Mr. Cartagena has been charged in federal court with narcotics conspiracy. He was arrested in Puerto Rico on Tuesday and will appear in court there Thursday, authorities said.

He has also been charged with causing Mr. Williams's death in connection to his alleged role in the narcotics ring, according to authorities.

Three other men, Hector Robles, Luis Cruz and Carlos Macci, were charged with conspiracy to distribute fentanyl, heroin and other drugs, the U.S. attorney's office said. They were expected to appear Wednesday in Manhattan federal court.

Fentanyl, a drug 50 to 100 times more potentthan morphine, is typically used for treating advanced pain, usually in cancer patients, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

Most cases of fentanyl-related overdoses in the U.S. recently have been linked to illegally made fentanyl, the CDC said. It is frequently mixed with heroin and/or cocaine to increase its narcotic effect. More than 36,000 people died from overdoses involving synthetic opioids in 2019, the CDC said.

Mr. Williams, a Brooklyn native, garnered praise for his role as Omar Little in HBO's "The Wire." He was also known for his roles in HBO's "Boardwalk Empire," as well as movies including "12 Years a Slave" and "Assassin's Creed."
